intro: Dichapetalum thouarsianum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical tree native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically a green, spherical berry with a thick, inedible skin. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it grows, though it is not widely cultivated for agricultural purposes.
